title: FTSE LIVE: HSBC said to be cutting jobs; De La Rue names new boss
text:
HSBC is planning to cut up to 10,000 jobs - around 4 per cent of its workforce, according to reports, as the banking group seeks to reduce costs.

Elsewhere today, troubled passport maker De La Rue has appointed Clive Vacher as its new boss. He will be tasked with delivering a major turnaround following a string of profit warnings at the firm and its failure to secure the contract to produce the UK's new blue passports.

US-China trade talks are scheduled to resume this week and will be the closely followed by traders.

The trade spat between the world's two largest economies has been a major source of volatility over the past year and was partly to blame for last week's FTSE rout.
